skill.name: ensembl-database
skill.description: Query Ensembl genome database REST API for 250+ species. Gene lookups, sequence retrieval, variant analysis, comparative genomics, orthologs, VEP predictions, for genomic research.
skill.summary: Query Ensembl genome database REST API for 250+ species. Gene lookups, sequence retrieval, variant a...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes an executable Python script that performs HTTP requests to documented Ensembl REST endpoints. No credential harvesting, environment access, or filesystem traversal was found.

low_findings.title: HTTP requests to external Ensembl endpoints
low_findings.description: The script issues outbound HTTP requests using requests, for example: "response = requests.post(url, headers=headers, json=data)" and "response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, params=params)". This is expected for API access but still allows data sent in queries to leave the machine.

low_findings.title: Executable CLI script present
low_findings.description: The repository includes a runnable Python script with a shebang line: "#!/usr/bin/env python3". Executable scripts can be run by users, so they should be reviewed for safety and scope.

content.value_statement: You need reliable gene, variant, and sequence data across species. This skill provides Ensembl REST queries with a ready-to-run Python client.
actual_capabilities: Look up genes by symbol with optional transcript expansion
Look up objects by Ensembl ID
Retrieve sequences by ID or region in JSON or FASTA
Query variant data by rsID with population frequency option
Predict variant effects using VEP HGVS notation
Find orthologs for a gene across species
limitations: Requires network access to Ensembl REST servers
Subject to Ensembl rate limits and 429 responses
Only provides data available in Ensembl releases
Requires Python and the requests library to run the script

use_cases.title: Gene annotation lookup
use_cases.description: Find gene coordinates, transcripts, and identifiers from a symbol or Ensembl ID.

use_cases.title: Variant consequence check
use_cases.description: Run VEP on an HGVS variant and summarize predicted effects.

use_cases.title: Ortholog discovery
use_cases.description: Identify orthologs for a gene and review homology results across species.

prompt_templates.title: Gene lookup
prompt_templates.prompt: Look up the human gene BRCA2 and summarize its location and main transcripts.

prompt_templates.title: Sequence retrieval
prompt_templates.prompt: Get the FASTA sequence for ENSG00000139618 and report the sequence length.

prompt_templates.title: Variant analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Run VEP for ENST00000380152.7:c.803C>T in human and summarize key consequences.

prompt_templates.title: Ortholog comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Find mouse orthologs for ENSG00000139618 and compare gene names and IDs.

output_examples.input: Check variant rs699 in human and summarize major annotations.
output: Variant rs699 found in human variation data
Includes population frequency fields and supporting identifiers

best_practices: Use supported species names and verify assembly before querying
Handle 429 responses with backoff and retry
Cache frequent queries to reduce API load
anti_patterns: Sending large batches without rate limiting
Assuming Ensembl covers all organisms or data types

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The prompts and workflows are designed to work on all three platforms.

faq.question: What limits should I expect?
faq.answer: Anonymous access is rate limited and may return 429 responses during bursts.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the provided Python script or REST patterns for automation.

faq.question: Does it access my local data or secrets?
faq.answer: No. The script only sends query data to Ensembl REST endpoints.

faq.question: What if a request fails?
faq.answer: Retry with backoff, verify IDs and species, and check Ensembl service status.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual browsing?
faq.answer: It automates lookups and batch queries without using the web interface.
